statementSentences.sentence: My practice focuses on helping individuals work through the self-defeating patterns that have created feelings of depression, anxiety and/or a general sense of feeling "stuck."
I practice psychodynamic psychotherapy.
My approach is to provide a warm, safe and supportive environment that focuses on the present but is grounded in understanding how the past is impacting present difficulties.
I help my patients work through and confront these negative repeating patterns that stand in their way to leading a more satisfying life.
I am committed to and have a diverse practice regarding race, culture and sexual orientation.
I have worked extensively with both adolescents and adults.

highlights.sentence: I am a seasoned, dedicated individual and couples therapist with over 15 years of experience treating adults struggling with anxiety, depression, loss and grieving, relationship issues and work challenges.

priceInformation.postReimbursementPrice: *After you've been to $1000/200 sessions, you are eligible to get around $160 back...

statementSentences.sentence: I am a seasoned, dedicated individual and couples therapist with over 15 years of experience treating adults struggling with anxiety, depression, loss and grieving, relationship issues and work challenges.

I will work collaboratively with you to gently and compassionately explore the recurring patterns in behavior and relating that cause you pain and stop you from getting what you want personally and professionally.
Well look to the past but spend most of our time in the present learning more effective ways to make decisions, take action and communicate with the important people in your life.
I specialize in anxiety disorders (generalized anxiety, social anxiety, panic disorders, OCD, and PTSD).
Through our work, you will understand and master your anxietys sources, feeling freer and more capable in situations that cause you fear or discomfort.
I also specialize in helping adults with ADD, and parenting issues.
My experiences living, studying and working in foreign countries have given me a unique perspective and special insight into the challenges of operating cross-culturally.
As a result, I work very effectively with expatriates, immigrants (recently and not so recently arrived), and their children.
I speak Mandarin Chinese and Swedish.

highlights.sentence: In addition, Dr. Couvadelli has expertise in treating mood disorders (anxiety, depression, bipolar), insomnia, social and behavioral issues.

statementSentences.sentence: Dr. Couvadelli is an adult and pediatric Neuropsychologist/Psychologist with areas of expertise in clinical neuropsychology, cognitive rehabilitation and health psychology.
Dr. Couvadelli obtained her PhD in Behavioral Medicine with a focus on Cognitive Neuroscience.
She completed an internship in clinical psychology/neuropsychology, a fellowship in cognitive rehabilitation, and a three-year postdoctoral fellowship in neuropsychology.
In addition she has obtained a medical degree from Greece.

Dr. Couvadelli has served as the head of Pediatric Neuropsychology at JFK Medical Center, NJ and she holds the appointment of Assistant Professor of Neuroscience at Seton Hall University School of Health/Medical Sciences.

Due to her unique background, Dr. Couvadelli can assess a variety of neurological, psychological and learning disorders (e.g.autism, ADHD, epilepsy, traumatic brain injury, brain tumors, dementia, depression, anxiety, insomnia, dyslexia etc) and in turn develop targeted intervention and treatment plans to ensure attainment of optimum life functioning.
In addition, Dr. Couvadelli has expertise in treating mood disorders (anxiety, depression, bipolar), insomnia, social and behavioral issues.
Treatment modalities include: Behavior Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Mindfulness-based Techniques and Cognitive Rehabilitation.

highlights.sentence: I have helped all kinds of clients who come with a variety of problems involving depression, anxiety, addictions, anger, social phobia and the like.

I specialize in working with creative people, helping them to get unblocked; with depressed or anxious people and people with self-esteem issues; and with people who have various sexual issues such as role confusion or gender identity confusion.

statementSentences.sentence: As a licensed psychoanalyst I have the training to get to the root of a persons problems.
I was required to undergo my own psychotherapy before I could be licensed.
I have helped all kinds of clients who come with a variety of problems involving depression, anxiety, addictions, anger, social phobia and the like.
I have also done my homework, researching and authoring 13 books on psychology.
With over 35 years of experience, I know how to be of most help to people, even if they dont.
You can read about me on my website: www.drschoenewolf.com.
Over the years I have dealt with all kinds of issues.

I specialize in working with creative people, helping them to get unblocked; with depressed or anxious people and people with self-esteem issues; and with people who have various sexual issues such as role confusion or gender identity confusion.
I think it is important for a therapist to be neutral and unbiased.
I do not have any religious or political biases and can really be there for people and allow them to be completely honest about their feelings and ideas.
This is essential for trust to develop and for the therapy to move forward.

highlights.sentence: I frequently work with individuals needing help with adjusting to significant life changes (i.e, coming out, sexual orientation, changes in relationships, marital status, career changes, beginning college, etc), coping with anxiety and stress, depression, self-esteem, LGBT issues, addiction and family troubles.

statementSentences.sentence: My psychoanalytic training and my 20 years work experience has taught me the importance of understanding the full individual and his/her own unique experience in the world.
In therapy, I provide a supportive environment that focuses on symptom-reduction while also exploring underlying roots of emotional discomfort.
I encourage self-exploration, emotional processing and self-acceptance.
I believe in helping clients understand how their past experiences impacts their lives, and in utilizing the therapeutic relationship to foster clients growth and self-fulfillment.
I find psychotherapy to be powerful and exciting and I consider it a privilege to help people strive for their potential.
In my private practice, I work primarily with adults and adolescents.

I frequently work with individuals needing help with adjusting to significant life changes (i.e, coming out, sexual orientation, changes in relationships, marital status, career changes, beginning college, etc), coping with anxiety and stress, depression, self-esteem, LGBT issues, addiction and family troubles.
I am a bilingual, Spanish-speaking psychotherapist, My offices are located in areas with easy access to public transportation.

highlights.sentence: I have a special interest in attachment styles and their implications in interpersonal conflict in families and couples.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a psychiatrist, psychoanalyst, with a specialty in addiction psychiatry with an integrative psychiatry practice based on a diagnostic assessment and treatment guided by biological, psychological, social, and behavioral paradigms.
I have a developmental orientation toward understanding human behavior.
I have a special interest in attachment styles and their implications in interpersonal conflict in families and couples.

I have a keen interest in the phase of life problems resulting in the major transitions in development such as the passage from adolescents to young adulthood, marriage, divorce, mid life adjustments, retirement, and grief and bereavement.

I have a specialty in psychoanalysis that informs my approach to elucidate the experiences of the past that influence the perspective in the here and now that motivates one to think, feel, and act in predictable patterns that influence agency, identity, empathy, and intimacy.
I have a multicultural sensitivity developed in the crucible of the rural South during the sunset of Jim Crow and the dawn of the civil rights movement.
This sensitivity was crystalized in the academic environment of a historically black college during this intense period of political activism and social change.

highlights.sentence: My therapeutic approach enables me to positively impact individuals struggling with anxiety, depression, ADHD, obsessions/ compulsions, phobias, post traumatic stress, dysregulated moods and delusional thinking.

statementSentences.sentence: No one should suffer from unnecessary psychological distress.
I specialize in "mindfulness" and cognitive-behavior therapy for children, adolescents and adults.
I have been practicing for more than twenty years and have helped many people achieve life goals that had previously seemed out of their reach.
I am fortunate that I love what I do.
This is evident in my dedication to my clients.
Their legacies are my rewards.

My therapeutic approach enables me to positively impact individuals struggling with anxiety, depression, ADHD, obsessions/ compulsions, phobias, post traumatic stress, dysregulated moods and delusional thinking.

As a cognitive-behaviorist, sessions focus on: learning to challenge faulty assumptions and thinking errors, developing thought stopping strategies, mood modulation, imagery exercises, desensitization, as well as training in assertiveness, anger control and social skills.
Breaking co-dependency patterns and developing emotional language is also a focus of treatment.
Coaching individuals through behavioral changes is an important part of creating new behavioral patterns and my passionate approach is conducive for success.
Clients find me easily accessible via text or telephone for extra coaching between sessions.
I offer evening and Saturday hours to accommodate work and school schedules.

highlights.sentence: Some of the issues that I work with most are mood disorders, anxiety, relationship difficulties, long range effects of trauma, eating problems and infertility.

statementSentences.sentence: Compassionate Collaboration ---- I am a Clinical Psychologist with over twenty years of experience as a psychotherapist.
Our work together would focus on finding a deeper understanding of your thoughts and emotions in order to look for conflicts that are holding you back.
Tolerating difficult feelings in therapy can help you to gain clarity and find more flexibility within yourself and help you to make healthy choices.

Treatment could involve working directly to reduce symptoms, exploring the past, expressing difficult feelings, looking at parts of the self which are often denied, challenging personal blocks and examining relationship issues Through this process I aim to be present, supportive and respectful of personal boundaries but also unafraid to confront difficult emotions and interpersonal moments.
I am open to feedback and hope you will always let me know about your reactions to therapy and to me.
Some of the issues that I work with most are mood disorders, anxiety, relationship difficulties, long range effects of trauma, eating problems and infertility.
I work with adults, couples, families and adolescents.
I also am a professor in the Mental Health Counseling Program at Brooklyn College.

highlights.sentence: My experience at a NYC hospital and in private practice working as a clinical social worker has given me valuable experience helping patients with: illnesses like HIV/AIDS; Cancer; Caregivers issues; Mood disorders like Depression or PTSD; OCD; Sexual addiction; history of sexual abuse; GLBTQ concerns and career strategies.

statementSentences.sentence: What is psychotherapy?
Its a process of discovering the causes of entrenched behaviors that are obstacles to achievement of longed for goals.
Over twenty five years of experience give me the expertise to help you identify troubling behaviors or distorted beliefs about yourself and discuss whats missing in your life.
Psychotherapy can help remove dysfunctional behaviors and habits that impede personal and career success so that you have a better chance of leading a rewarding life.
If you commit to this work Im confident I can help you accomplish goals which we set for our work together.

My experience at a NYC hospital and in private practice working as a clinical social worker has given me valuable experience helping patients with: illnesses like HIV/AIDS; Cancer; Caregivers issues; Mood disorders like Depression or PTSD; OCD; Sexual addiction; history of sexual abuse; GLBTQ concerns and career strategies.
My office is located in midtown Manhattan, north of Madison Square Park in the Flatiron District.
Many subway lines are convenient to this office.
Hours by appointment Monday thru Thursday.

statementSentences.sentence: Do you ever act against your own better judgment and even your best interests without really knowing why?
Has this lead to problems like depression, anxiety, anger, relationship issues, substance abuse, poor self-care, low self-esteem or avoidance?
The focus of my practice is to help you know yourself better - your thoughts, feelings and behavior - so you can make choices that will improve the quality of your life.
I will work collaboratively with you to help you discover why you might not be reaching goals youve set for yourself and together, we will develop a plan to overcome whatever roadblocks we find.

Ive spent eighteen years counseling people experiencing anxiety, relationship issues, depression, trauma, chronic medical illness, identity issues, substance abuse and anger - helping those who feel overwhelmed find solutions that work for them.
If you are seeking to change specific behaviors like substance abuse, overeating and procrastination, I use a very effective type of therapy called Motivational Interviewing.
This approach involves understanding the costs and benefits of problem behaviors, reasons why changing them is so difficult and realistic planning to make desired changes.

statementSentences.sentence: My Model: Celebrating the equal relationship between the client and facilitator, we move with the flow of energy between the parties: the client as the expert on self, and the facilitator as the expert on the theories of psychological change.
DW Winnicott reminds us of the beauty and function of playing:involving fantasy, creativity and energy flow.
We bring the unconscious to the conscious mind with the specific goal of moving toward desired changes, as we nurture the healing process.
I focus on wellness, as I strongly believe that we can create what we want in our lives.
We need to realize how powerful we are!
Our most important relationship is with ourselves: when we know and love ourselves, we can attract positive situations in our lives.
Sliding scale - fees I focus on healing and see myself as a consultant for my clients, coaching and sharing ideas.
Click onto www.sedonacreativelife.com/pre1000.html and visit LindaMarsanico.com to read and/or comment on my blog.

statementSentences.sentence: My goal is to help you become a happy-go-lucky-well-adjusted-individual in life using fundamental principles of traditional psychotherapy, evidence based medicine, and providing you education about your mind and body.
I foster healing on all levels: emotional, physical, and mental.

People who receive treatment with me are choosing a path of self-exploration that can yield many benefits; I can help you 1) identify factors that perpetuate problems and change them, 2) have the option of medication treatment when appropriate, and 3) help you become aware of fears & hurts which may lead to your psychological freedom.
I am a Medical Doctor with Board Certifications in Adult, Child & Adolescent Psychiatry, Forensic Psychiatry, Psychosomatic Medicine, and Addiction Medicine.
I am Assistant Clinical Professor at the NYU Department of Psychiatry and the NYU Child Study Center.
I provide true holistic care, including medication treatment for addictions (i.e.
Suboxone (buprenorphine) for opiate dependence), and conduct Forensic Psychiatric evaluations.

I have a repertoire of knowledge acquired through years of training at Johns Hopkins Hospital, NYU School of Medicine, and the George Washington University which gives me a unique ability to help adults, Adolescents and Children, understanding their early life issues, complications with medical conditions, substance abuse problems, and any overlapping legal (forensic) issues.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a licensed clinical psychologist with over 8 years of experience, specializing in the treatment of anxiety and mood disorders such as excessive worry, depression, panic attacks, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and phobias.
I also help individuals adjust and adapt to common life stressors such as relational issues and those that people experience at work.
I utilize an integrative approach involving both psychodynamic and cognitive behavioral therapy that is individualized based on patients needs and presenting problems.
I integrate mindfulness into my practice to help clients learn to be more accepting of who they are while allowing for changes that lead to symptom reduction.
In addition to my practice I work with older adults in various settings, which gives me a greater understanding of life-span development, and how people cope with loss and change.
My office is located near the A,C,E,1,2,3,B,D,F,M trains.

statementSentences.sentence: Emotional wellbeing is an integral part to leading a balanced and fulfilling life.
When there is emotional dis-ease, there is pain and suffering.
These are key indicators that there is a need to slow down, take stock and process how you are feeling and what you are experiencing .
Therapy offers the space and time to slow down, reflect and gain clarity into our emotional experiences.
Everyone has the inherent capacity to heal within themselves at any given moment.
Love, patience, non-judgment and trust are the guideposts that allow and encourage healing to occur.

statementSentences.sentence: Finding the right therapist is the first step towards healing and the relief of your pain.
A trusting relationship is the essence of effective treatment.
You need to feel connected and understood in order to share your internal world.
My empathic capacities will enable you to feel safe enough to explore the problems which have hindered your life and relationships.
I use psychodynamic methods to establish a caring professional relationship that will allow us to understand your pain and work through your difficulties.
I am a licensed clinical social worker with advanced post-graduate training in relational psychotherapy and psychoanalysis and in trauma studies.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a clinical psychologist with many years of experience working with varied populations.

I work with adults of all ages, ranging from young adults to elderly who struggle with depression, anxiety, caregiver burnout, adjustment to parenthood/retirement, fertility concerns, and relationship issues.
I am familiar with and enjoy working with people from different racial and cultural backgrounds, including those who have faced immigration issues and difficulties adapting to American society.

My integrative approach incorporates techniques from psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral and mindfulness therapies.
As a therapist, my first job is to provide you with a warm and supportive space where you can start opening up about your past and present difficulties.
Together we will explore your thoughts, feelings and patterns.
I will guide you towards more positive ways of coping with your feelings.
I believe people can grow, learn and change at every stage of life.
I look forward to hearing from you and helping you find some relief and live a happier and healthier life.

statementSentences.sentence: Going through a tough time?
